alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 19 at 3:07PM MST until December 21 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TUESDAY TO 10 AM PST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations between 6 and 17 inches, higher amounts in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Fernwood, Kellogg, Dobson Pass, St. Maries, Pinehurst, Mullan, Wallace, Fourth Of July Pass, Lookout Pass, and Osburn. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Tuesday to 10 AM PST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from late Tuesday night through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Wind chill values may fall to extremely dangerous levels. Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute Tuesday and Tuesday evening. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Periods of moderate to heavy snow will be possible Tuesday evening and night impacting the Tuesday evening commute. Keep pets indoors as much as possible. Make frequent checks on older family, friends, and neighbors. Ensure portable heaters are used correctly. Do not use generators or grills inside. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
